metadata.Title: CVE-2020-6810 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
After a website had entered fullscreen mode, it could have used apreviously opened popup to obscure the notification that indicates thebrowser is in fullscreen mode. Combined with spoofing the browser chrome,this could have led to confusing the user about the current origin of thepage and credential theft or other attacks. This vulnerability affectsFirefox < 74.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6810` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 74.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 74.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 74.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '74.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
mozjs52 package in esm-apps/focal is affected and may need fixing.
